articles.author: Preethi
articles.description:
Calendars, shopping carts, galleries, file explorers, and online libraries are some situations where selectable items are shown in grids (i.e. square lattices). You know, even those security checks that ask you to select all images with crosswalks or whatever.
ğŸ§â€¦
Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Well, sheesh. I opened a little can of worms when sharing Miriamâ€™s â€œAm I on the IndieWeb yet?â€ with a short post bemoaning my own trouble getting on the IndieWeb train. But itâ€™s a good can of worms.
I think â€¦
De-Mystifying IndieWeb on a WordPress Site originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: De-Mystifying IndieWeb on a WordPress Site

articles.author: Aisha Bukar
articles.description:
A diagram is a graphical representation of information that depicts the structure, relationship, or operation of anything. Diagrams enable your audience to visually grasp hidden information and engage with them in ways that words alone cannot. Depending on the type â€¦
Useful Tools for Visualizing Databases on a Budget originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Useful Tools for Visualizing Databases on a Budget

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
Making CSS-only loaders is one of my favorite tasks. Itâ€™s always satisfying to look at those infinite animations. And, of course, there are lots of techniques and approaches to make them â€” no need to look further than CodePen to â€¦
Single Element Loaders: The Spinner originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.description:

â€¦

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
QR codes are funny, right? We love them, then hate them, then love them again. Anyways, theyâ€™ve lately been popping up again and it got me thinking about how theyâ€™re made. There are like a gazillion QR code generators out â€¦
Letâ€™s Make a QR Code Generator With a Serverless Function! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Letâ€™s Make a QR Code Generator With a Serverless Function!

articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
Those of us whoâ€™ve been web developers more than a few years have probably written code using more than one JavaScript framework. With all the choices out there â€” React, Svelte, Vue, Angular, Solid â€” itâ€™s all but inevitable. One â€¦

articles.author: Ganesh Dahal
articles.description:
Block patterns, also frequently referred to as sections, were introduced in WordPress 5.5 to allow users to build and share predefined block layouts in the pattern directory. The directory is the home of a wide range of â€¦
How to Create Block Theme Patterns in WordPress 6.0 originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Nolan Lawson sparked some discussion when he described a noticeable shift away from single-page applications (SPAs):
Hip new frameworks like Astro, Qwik, and Elder.js are touting their MPA [multi-page application] with â€œ0kB JavaScript by default.â€

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
It wasnâ€™t long ago that Nick Sypteras showed us how to make custom badges for a GitHub repo. Well, Reza Shakeri put Beautify GitHub Profile together and itâ€™s a huuuuuuge repo of different badges that pulls lots of examples â€¦
